thread.title: H.S. girls tennis: Individual state tournament update
thread.title_full: H.S. girls tennis: Individual state tournament update

title: H.S. girls tennis: Individual state tournament update
text:
Print 
WEST WINDSOR – Andrea Cerdan and Stephanie Schrage train with the same coach at Garden State Tennis Center in Edison. 
That explains why they looked like clones at Sunday’s state individual tournament, trading howitzer forehands and backhands for roughly 80 minutes before Millburn’s Schrage took a 6-4, 6-4 quarterfinal-round decision from the Paramus Catholic freshman. 
"Our coach teaches us the same things so we have the same game," Cerdan said. "We knew it’d be close." 
Cerdan battled back from early deficits in both sets to get back on serve. Both times, Schrage led 5-4 before breaking Cerdan’s serve to win the set. 
Interestingly, it was the first time they faced off in an actual match, having only played practice sets. Schrage said it "brought up the level of play for both of us." 
After her riveting slugfest against Cerdan, Schrage beat Holy Angels freshman Ashley Hess in the semifinals, 6-0 and 6-0. 
Earlier in the day, the sixth-seeded Hess defeated East Brunswick’s 10th-seeded Jennifer Chen in the quarterfinals by scores of 6-3 and 7-6(5). In the doubles competition, Northern Highlands’ sixth-seeded pair of Sarah Apsey and Chloe Decker dropped a super tiebreaker to Millburn’s top-seeded Isabella Waung and Sydney Zirlin in the quarterfinals (6-1, 4-6, 10-7). © 2015 North Jersey Media Group Tags:
